Package Order

Class OrderCtrl

  • java.lang.Object
    • util.Controller
      • Order.OrderCtrl
  • public class OrderCtrl
extends Controller
    A control class that mediates between Order entity objects and the OrderUI boundary object. This control class reads from and writes to an order data file.
    Author:
    Glenda Hong Zixuan

      • validTableID

        public boolean validTableID​(int tableID,
                            Table.TableStatus status)
        Checks whether a table ID is valid and whether the corresponding Table object is set to a specific TableStatus
        Parameters:
        tableID - The table ID to be checked.
        status - The TableStatus value that the Table object should be set to.
        Returns:
        true if the table ID is valid and the corresponding Table object is set to status, otherwise false.

      • validEmployeeID

        Parameters:
        employeeID - The employee ID to be checked
        Returns:
        true if the employee ID is valid, otherwise false.

      • getOrderItemNames

        public java.lang.String[] getOrderItemNames​(int tableID)
                                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Gets the names of order items contained in a specific Order object.
        Parameters:
        tableID - The table ID of the target Order object.
        Returns:
        the names of order items contained in the target Order object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the method (getOrderObject) called throws an exception.

      • createOrder

        public void createOrder​(int tableID,
                        java.lang.String staffName,
                        java.lang.String[] itemNames,
                        int[] itemNums)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Creates a new Order object and writes its data into the order data file. Once a new order is created, the corresponding Table object is set to TableStatus.OCCUPIED.
        Parameters:
        tableID - The table ID of the new Order object.
        staffName - The staff name of the new Order object.
        itemNames - The names of the order items to be contained in the new Order object.
        itemNums - The numbers of the order items to be contained in the new Order object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if either of the methods (getOrderItemPrice and appendOrderData) called throws an exception.

      • viewOrder

        public java.lang.String viewOrder​(int tableID)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns a specific Order object as a string to be printed.
        Parameters:
        tableID - The table ID of the target Order object.
        Returns:
        the target Order object string.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the method (getOrderObject) called throws an exception.

      • addOrderItem

        public void addOrderItem​(int tableID,
                         java.lang.String newItemName,
                         int newItemNum)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Add an order item to a specific Order object and writes the data of the new object into the order data file.
        Parameters:
        tableID - The table ID of the target Order object.
        newItemName - The name of the order item to be added.
        newItemNum - The number of the order item to be added.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if either of the methods (getOrderObject and editOrderData) called throws an exception.

      • removeOrderItem

        public boolean removeOrderItem​(int tableID,
                               java.lang.String itemName)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Removes a specific order item from a specific Order object and writes the data of the new object into the order data file.
        Parameters:
        tableID - The table ID of the target Order object.
        itemName - The name of the target order item.
        Returns:
        true if the target order item is removed from the target Order object and the data of the new object is written into the order data file, otherwise false.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if either of the methods (getOrderObject and editOrderData) called throws an exception.
